what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: ukcensus R package designed simplify retrieval analysis Census 2021 data England Wales. allows create custom datasets census, outputting tibble format.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version ukcensus using devtools package:
code: # Install devtools if not already installed if (!require(devtools)) {   install.packages("devtools") }  # Install ukcensus from GitHub devtools::install_github("dataknit/ukcensus")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: ukcensus built around create_custom_dataset() function. example, create dataset age usual residents MSOA, write: know put query? ’s get_available_ set functions come handy. can use get available: populations: (e.g. households usual residents) area types: level geographic specificity (e.g. country, Local Authority LSOA) areas: areas available given area type variables: sociodemographic variables (e.g. age, English language proficiency, disability status) data available categorisations: given variable, divide values (e.g. age 101 categories 2) function outputs available options tibble. typical workflow go get_available_ functions determine values put create_custom_dataset.
code: library(ukcensus) create_custom_dataset("msoa", "resident_age_6a") |>   head() #> 7264 out of 7264 areas available #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   msoa               resident_age_6a             n #>   <chr>              <chr>                   <int> #> 1 City of London 001 Aged 15 years and under   579 #> 2 City of London 001 Aged 16 to 24 years      1149 #> 3 City of London 001 Aged 25 to 34 years      2215 #> 4 City of London 001 Aged 35 to 49 years      1817 #> 5 City of London 001 Aged 50 to 64 years      1617 #> 6 City of London 001 Aged 65 years and over   1206 get_available_variables() #> # A tibble: 44 × 5 #>    id                       label description total_count quality_statement_text #>    <chr>                    <chr> <chr>             <int> <chr>                  #>  1 activity_last_week       Econ… "This vari…           8 "As Census 2021 was d… #>  2 age_arrival_uk_23a       Age … "The date …          23 ""                     #>  3 alternative_address_ind… Seco… "An addres…           3 "The true number of p… #>  4 country_of_birth_190a    Coun… "The count…         190 ""                     #>  5 country_of_birth_60a     Coun… "The count…          60 ""                     #>  6 disability               Disa… "People wh…           5 ""                     #>  7 economic_activity_statu… Econ… "People ag…          12 "As Census 2021 was d… #>  8 english_proficiency      Prof… "How well …           6 ""                     #>  9 ethnic_group_tb_20b      Ethn… "The ethni…          20 ""                     #> 10 has_ever_worked          Empl… "Classifie…           4 "As Census 2021 was d… #> # ℹ 34 more rows

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: welcome contributions ukcensus package. suggestions, bug reports, want contribute code, please open issue submit pull request GitHub repository.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: ukcensus package open-source distributed MIT License. See LICENSE file details.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: ukcensus package made possible England Wales’ Office National Statistics (ONS) work designing collecting census making available open API. package uses Create Custom Dataset functionality.

title: Create custom dataset — create_custom_dataset
code: create_custom_dataset(   area_type,   variables,   population_type = "UR",   remove_zeroes = FALSE,   column_names = "id" )
